title: Rahul called India-US deal a 'surrender'. But it's not — here’s why
content: As Washington recalibrates its language on the interim India-US trade deal, the $500 billion trade target has sparked sharp political debate at home. While Rahul Gandhi calls it a “surrender,” exporters and trade officials argue the numbers are achievable — and that steady diplomacy, not theatrics, will define the outcome

title: A boy from Bihar, now the man for UAE: Sohaib Khan's Gaya-to-glory story
content: Sohaib Khan’s 51 off 29 anchored UAE’s chase against Canada, but the innings was more than numbers. Born in Bihar and shaped in Delhi’s Jamia, he moved to the UAE during COVID, working as a financial consultant while chasing cricket at night. On a World Cup stage in Delhi, the late bloomer proved a boy from Gaya could become a hero for UAE.

title: Market crash: Investors lose Rs 9.5L cr in just two days!
content: The overall market capitalization of companies listed on the BSE shrank by Rs 7,02,017.71 crore, bringing the total valuation down to Rs 4,65,46,643.20 crore ($5.13 trillion). In the last two trading sessions investors have lost Rs 9.5 lakh crore.

title: After Ford lost nearly $5 billion, CEO Jim Farley says: We got the message that ...
content: Ford's electric vehicle unit reported a significant $4.8 billion loss in 2025 as sales of key models declined. Facing slowing EV demand and rising hybrid interest, the automaker is pivoting to extended-range EVs and developing a lower-cost EV platform. Ford anticipates its EV business will remain unprofitable until around 2029.

title: Pitch to blame for Australia's loss to Zimbabwe? Batter gives verdict
content: "I think that's just the nature of cricket. You get a sub-continent team come to Australia and you don't get them complaining about the bounce or the pace," Renshaw said at post-match press conference

title: Happy Valentine’s Day 2026: Wishes, messages, images, status and captions
content: Valentine's Week has arrived, transforming markets and social media with romantic gestures. Beyond grand displays, the article emphasizes the power of sincere messages, offering heartfelt, playful, and subtle ideas for expressing love, appreciation, and self-care. It highlights that genuine connection and thoughtful expression are what truly matter during this time.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: Will Abhishek Sharma play vs Pakistan? Major health update ahead of Colombo thriller
content: Star India opener Abhishek Sharma has been discharged from the hospital after recovering from a stomach infection. He missed the game against Namibia due to illness but shared a positive fitness update, indicating he is on the mend. Sharma's return will be a boost for the Indian team.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: BNP sweeps Bangladesh election: What's next for Muhammad Yunus?
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party has secured a decisive victory, paving the way for Tarique Rahman as prime minister. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, who led the interim government after a 2024 uprising, is expected to step down. His tenure focused on restoring order and implementing reforms, but the incoming government will face challenges of political polarization and foreign policy recalibration.

title: Ranveer Singh gets new threat, caller linked to Bishnoi gang warns Bollywood
content: Days after receiving an extortion threat, Ranveer Singh has now been sent another disturbing voice note — this time from a man claiming to be associated with the Bishnoi gang. The development comes close on the heels of heightened security outside the actor’s Mumbai residence.

title: Patrick Mahomes and Brittany Mahomes make $1M move before season
content: Patrick Mahomes, the Kansas City Chiefs’ star player, is fully focused on recovering from his brutal injuries, after recording a pretty tough time on the field in the last season. As he focuses on his recovery, Patrick Mahomes and his wife, Brittany Mahomes, just pulled off a million dollar move, away from the world of NFL, which has now broken records.

title: Cardi B fights back tears amid Stefon Diggs breakup rumors
content: NFL star Stefon Diggs and Grammy winning rapper Cardi B are reportedly on a temporary break ever since Diggs lost his chance at Super Bowl LX. This has sparked speculation especially after they reportedly unfollowed each other on social media. Diggs shared cryptic posts about gratitude, motivation, and subtle hints about the Bodak Yellow singer after the Super Bowl loss. While Cardi appeared heavily emotional during her Little Miss Drama Tour’s opening night, asking her audience to protect their happiness amidst her own breakup rumors.

title: Josh Morrissey doubtful for Switzerland as injury update remains unclear
content: Team Canada is in limbo following the team's defenseman, Josh Morrissey, who left the Olympic match against Team Czechia with an unexplained injury. There was no obvious update given by head coach Jon Cooper, and the question arises concerning the availability of Morrissey in the next game against Team Switzerland. The state of affairs can also affect the defensive pairings when Canada is gearing towards its next vital Olympic competition.

title: 'Not a fair fight': Rahul targets PM, calls US trade deal 'one-sided pressure' on farmers
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the India-US trade deal, dubbing PM Modi as "Narendra Surrender Modi" and accusing him of betraying farmers. He argued the agreement creates an unfair fight for country's farmers against subsidized foreign crops. Union ministers Piyush Goyal and Shivraj Singh Chouhan refuted these claims, calling them baseless and accusing Gandhi of misleading the public.

title: 'When India re-wrote its fate': PM Modi on Seva Teerth, Kartavya Bhawans
content: ​The Prime Minister said the newly inaugurated buildings reflect India’s commitment to citizen-centric governance and national progress. "Today we all are witnessing a new history being made... This day of 13th February is witnessing a new beginning in India's development journey... Today, we are all entering Seva Teerth and Kartavya Bhavan with the resolve to achieve 'Viksit Bharat'. We have the divine blessings of achieving our goals," he said.

title: Donna Kelce shares sad Tom Brady photo after Jason’s Super Bowl win
content: Travis Kelce’s mother, Donna Kelce, has a never heard before way of celebrating her sons’ wins, once she posted a photo of an opponent’s disappointment. Jason Kelce said it was a picture of Tom Brady who was upset after his Super Bowl LII loss. This celebration style might be coming from her longstanding banking experience, where losses seem to have a longer impact than gains.

title: India's Hasina dilemma: Resurgent BNP seeks extradition - what are New Delhi's options?
content: As Bangladesh's new government, led by the BNP, takes charge of country's affair, it has called on India for the extradition of ousted former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who is in New Delhi. This demand presents a significant diplomatic challenge for India. Dhaka says, it seeks a relationship based on equality and mutual respect, with border security and water sharing also key issues.

title: Rohit Shetty makes first public appearance with son amid heavy security at Mumbai airport
content: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport following a firing incident outside his residence. Accompanied by heavy security, he was seen bidding an emotional farewell to his son. The sighting comes after reports of gunshots near his home, leading to an ongoing investigation and increased security measures in the area.

title: 2,842 Gazans vaporised by thermobaric bombs? All about shocking weapon 'used' by Israel
content: Thousands of Palestinians have reportedly gone missing in Gaza since October 2023, with Civil Defense teams documenting at least 2,842 disappearances. Military experts suggest the use of high-temperature weapons, like thermobaric munitions, may be responsible for the extreme incineration of human tissue, leaving only biological traces.

title: B'desh polls: PM Modi dials BNP's Tarique Rahman, hails 'remarkable victory'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Tarique Rahman on the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's decisive election victory, reaffirming India's commitment to close bilateral ties. Rahman, son of BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, is expected to become prime minister following the party's significant win, ushering in potential political stability.

title: Draft I-T rules 2026 explained: How you can save Rs 1.41 lakh tax outgo
content: What do the draft income tax rules mean for the common man? How does the calculation math for the old vs new income tax regime change? How much more tax can you now save under the old regime with revised exemption and deduction limits? Here are the top changes taxpayers should know:

title: Lakhpati Didis, farmers & start-ups: Details of first files signed by PM Modi at new office
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi signed a series of files from his new office complex, Seva Teerth. He approved a series of decisions focusing on women, youth, farmers and vulnerable citizens. According to the government, the first decisions from Seva Teerth reflect a spirit of “Seva” and aim to touch every section of society.

title: China sees red as CIA releases video appealing to potential PLA spies
content: The CIA's new Chinese-language recruitment video, targeting China's military, has sparked outrage in Beijing. The clip depicts a PLA officer disillusioned by corruption, a theme echoed by recent purges of top generals. China vows "all necessary measures" against foreign espionage, escalating intelligence rivalry amid US efforts to rebuild its China network.

title: Hit, treat, repeat: Thailand cricketer bleeds to perfect idol SKY's 'Supla' shot
content: Thailand cricketer Natthakan Chantham is diligently practicing Suryakumar Yadav's signature 'Supla shot', enduring numerous hits in her pursuit of mastering the stroke.  She aims to showcase this fearless batting style, inspired by Yadav, at the upcoming ACC Women’s Asia Cup Rising Stars 2026 in Bangkok.

title: Palash Muchhal gets relief from Bombay HC in defamation case against Vidnyan Mane
content: Singer Palash Muchhal received interim relief from the Bombay High Court against Vidnyan Mane, who made explosive allegations about Muchhal's cancelled wedding to Smriti Mandhana. The court restrained Mane from publishing further statements, citing potential reputational damage. Mane had accused Muchhal of infidelity and financial fraud, claims Muchhal has vehemently denied.

title: Congress, AITMC congratulate BNP for winning parliamentary elections in Bangladesh
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee extend greetings to the victorious BNP a day after voting had ended in the neighbouring country

title: Chennithala serves privilege notice against Vasavan
content: The notice was served over “contradictory and unrealistic replies” in the Assembly regarding the amount spent by the Travancore Devaswom Board for the Global Ayyappa Sangam

title: Accused Nikhil Gupta pleads guilty in U.S. court over murder-for-hire plot against Sikh separatist Pannun
content: Gupta has been jailed in Brooklyn since his ‌June 2024 extradition to the U.S. from the Czech Republic, where he had been arrested ⁠a year earlier. He had pleaded not guilty previously

title: IAF, Royal Thai Air Force jointly conduct air combat exercise in Indian Ocean Region
content: IAF assets operated from airbases in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, demonstrating strategic reach into the IOR, while the Thai Gripen fighters were launched from bases in Thailand

title: Give ‘some acknowledgement’ to Dhrupad singer, Supreme Court asks A.R. Rahman
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi was hearing a plea by Mr. Wasifuddin Dagar against the September 2025 Delhi High Court order, which had held there was no prima facie evidence of the Junior Dagar Brothers being the authors of a classical rendition of “Shiv Stuti”.

title: MHA to compile standard English medical dictionary to promote medical education in Indian languages
content: Invites bids from publishers to compile a standard English medical dictionary that can be translated into 15 Indian languages

title: Relocating racing tracks from BTC to Kunigal will be time and cost intensive
content: The century-old club has estimated that a new 2,200 m-2,400 m track laying, matching up to international standards, could cost upto ₹600 crore

title: After Independence, India wanted good ties with China: CDS Anil Chauhan
content: General Anil Chauhan underlines the increasing strategic importance of the Himalayan frontiers, highlights the government’s efforts on infrastructure development in such border areas

title: Telecom operators do not own spectrum, cannot list the public resource as an ‘asset’ for insolvency or liquidation: Supreme Court
content: The Bench of Justices P.S. Narasimha and Atul Chandurkar says spectrum is a scarce natural resource owned by the people of India, with legal title vesting exclusively in the Union of India, which holds it in trust for the public

title: Sewage pollution: PCB awaits court directive before initiating further steps
content: The Kerala State Pollution Control Board had earlier sent notices to 71 apartment complexes and commercial units located close to the Thevara-Perandoor and Edappally canals for not having STPs

title: A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan advocates for apolitical temple trust boards
content: A 22-km Giri Pradakshina route, developed with an approximate cost of ₹10 crore, around Srikalahasti temple inaugurated

title: DGCA slaps ₹1 crore fine on Air India for operating plane without requisite certification
content: On November 26, 2025, the airline informed the DGCA about the flying of the A320 aircraft with the expired airworthiness review certificate (ARC) on eight revenue sectors

title: BRS performance in municipal polls is highly encouraging: KTR
content: BRS working president: Despite misuse of power by the ruling party on a large-scale, people supported us

title: A.P. treasury benches unhappy with reply of Revenue Minister on grievance redressal
content: Closing petitions submitted by the people is not a solution, say TDP MLAs, adding that rendering justice is also necessary

title: KIIFB in-principle nod for MC Road and Sabari Rail projects
content: A board meeting gives approval for providing funding to the tune of ₹5,217 crore for the four-laning of the Kesavadasapuram-Angamaly MC Road, ₹1,900 crore for the Angamaly-Erumely Sabari Rail project and ₹600 crore for the Aerospace Control Systems Complex proposed under KSpace among other key infra projects

title: How can Ambati Rambabu’s ‘derogatory remarks’ against Chief Minister’s mother be taken lightly, asks Lokesh
content: The HRD Minister asserts that the coalition government does not engage in vendetta politics, but it will take strict action against anyone who speaks disrespectfully about women

title: Sensex down over 1,000 points - top 5 reasons for fall
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the equity benchmarks, crashed in trade on Friday amid weak global cues and the continued IT stocks selloff. While Nifty50 went below 25,600, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 release timings for all regions
content: Marvel Rivals gears up for its major mid-season update, Season 6.5, launching February 13, 2026. The highly anticipated addition is Elsa Bloodstone, the 47th playable hero and a new Duelist. This update also promises significant meta-shifting balance changes and a Valentine's Day celebration, enhancing the hero shooter experience for players worldwide.

title: Man collapses, dies at TVK chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Salem
content: A 37-year-old guest worker from Maharashtra, Siraj, tragically passed away during a political meeting in Salem. He had been living in the city for two decades with his family and was known for making silver rings and working in construction.

title: Why Nehru recognised Tibet as a part of China — CDS Anil Chauhan explains
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan stated that Jawaharlal Nehru recognized Tibet as part of China to foster a strong relationship, recalling the Panchsheel agreement. He emphasized that India must reconsider its perspective on Himalayan boundaries, particularly in Uttarakhand's middle sector, where the Himalayas have historically served as interaction zones.

title: ‘If he pauses...’: Ashwin’s fascinating advice to India before Usman Tariq test
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has devised a clever strategy for India's batters facing Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq. Ashwin suggests batters can leverage the rules by stepping away if Tariq pauses during his run-up, potentially unsettling the bowler and shifting pressure. He also highlighted the difficulty umpires face in judging Tariq's action in real-time, advocating for better technology.

title: Ankur Warikoo shares 5 green flags and 3 red flags of a toxic workplace
content: Entrepreneur Ankur Warikoo identified five green flags for healthy workplaces, including respect, acknowledgement, fair rewards, growth, and mentorship. He also warned of three red flags: dreading work, enduring long hours for minimal pay, and a dismissive "be grateful" attitude. Warikoo emphasizes that a good job challenges without breaking you, urging readers to seek environments that uplift.

title: Mafia don Mukhtar Ansari’s shooter Shoaib Kidwai shot dead in UP's Barabanki
content: A close associate of slain mafia don Mukhtar Ansari, Shoaib Kidwai alias Bobby, was shot dead in broad daylight in Barabanki. Motorcycle-borne assailants intercepted his car and fired over ten rounds. Police are scanning CCTV footage and have launched combing operations, suspecting gang rivalry as the motive.

title: Title deeds to be distributed to over 1 lakh families at Haveri on Saturday
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will inaugurate the programme, while Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar will distribute the title deeds

title: Former Minister Ambati Rambabu remanded in judicial custody in ‘illegal lottery’ case
content: Police seeking his custody for further investigation into the case filed against the YSRCP leader in 2023

title: Ivory theft from Pangode military establishment catches Forest department off guard
content: Forest department unaware of possession of ivory at military establishment. An investigation will be launched after receiving formal communication from authorities concerned, say officials

title: Adani Group enters nuclear power sector
content: In a notice to the NSE, Adani Power says it has incorporated a wholly owned subsidiary Adani Atomic Energy Ltd; first private player to enter the sector since it was opened up via the SHANTI Act two months ago

title: AAIB preliminary report on plane crash near Baramati to be released very soon: Civil Aviation Minister
content: On February 10, NCP (SP) MLA Rohit Pawar alleged that there was reason to suspect sabotage in the tragic air crash that killed his uncle Ajit Pawar and demanded a comprehensive probe by multiple expert agencies

title: Chittoor spruced up for Mahasivaratri festivities
content: APSRTC to ply over 24 special buses from various parts of Chittoor district to major Shaivite centres, including Srisailam Temple, Kotappakonda, and Draksharamam Temple

title: Heritage Foods Ltd. denies link with Indapur Dairy, condemns ‘motivated campaign’
content: The allegations linking it to the ghee supplied by the Maharashtra-based dairy to the TTD are completely unfounded and have no connection to the company, clarifies Heritage Foods COO

title: Land acquisition process begins for Musi Riverfront Development
content: The Musi Riverfront Development Corporation Limited has issued a notification for land to be acquired  — 9.2 kilometre stretch between Himayatsagar and Gandhi Sarovar and the 11.8 kilometre stretch between Osmansagar and Gandhi Sarovar

title: Kerala govt. insisting on SilverLine as standalone project, says railway ministry
content: Ministry says its advice to the KRDCL to revise the DPR in line with the latest technical standards to integrate it with the existing network, but the suggestion has not been heeded

title: Will use electric motor boats at Pykara lake in future, TTDC assures Madras High Court
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy told that the tourism development corporation will stop purchasing petrol motor boats

title: APTDC, Maritime Board urge people to attend Pakala Beach Festival on February 14-15
content: Six ministers to grace the event, the two-day festival will feature water sports, cultural shows, helicopter ride, and many other entertainment programmes

title: Names of voters not deleted in Belagavi district, says Minister
content: Booth Level officers (BLOs) have completed around 70% of mapping of names till now, says Satish Jarkiholi

title: IMA observes ‘Public Health Protection Day’
content: IMA demands that small and medium hospitals in Kerala be exempted from within the purview of the Kerala Clinical Establishments (KCE) Act so that the common public can continue to access affordable and quality health care.

title: State committed to special policy for children with disabilities: Minister K. Rajan
content: The Minister was speaking at the inauguration ceremony of ‘Thillana-2026’ — the Kudumbashree Buds State Arts Festival at Vellanikkara in Thrissur

title: Assets worth ₹1.8 crore found during raid at survey supervisor’s office and home in Hubballi
content: The raid was carried out following complaints about possession of assets disproportionate to the officer’s known source of income

title: NIA gets 45 days extension to file chargesheet in Delhi blast case
content: The agency approached the court seeking a 90-day extension to complete its investigation but it granted only half of the requested period and instructed the agency to wrap up the probe within the revised deadline

title: Enough is enough, this must stop, says Karnataka Home Minister on constant speculation on leadership change
content: AICC President Mallikarjun Kharge has gone to the extent of saying that everyone should keep their mouths shut. He cannot be stricter: Parameshwara

title: SIR hearings over in Thrissur
content: Final voters’ list to be published on February 21.  To ensure voter convenience, Assistant Electoral Registration Officers held hearings at 535 centres across the district

title: Bangladesh elections: What does BNP’s win mean for India?
content: In Bangladesh’s big election, the BNP scores a major win against the Islamist Jamaat in coalition NCP Gen Z party that ousted Sheikh Hasina. Muhammad Yunus delivers on his promise of elections, but without the Awami League, can the results from Bangladesh’s poll be politically sustainable? And what does it mean for India? We will get you ground reports from The Hindu’s Kallol Bhattacherjee in Dhaka.

title: Multi-pronged strategy to curb cybercrime in State, says Home Minister Anitha
content: Awareness campaigns on emerging trends and reporting mechanism, prompt action through cyber helpline, and capacity building of police personnel among the measures being taken, says the Home Minister

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

title: NFL wins grievance regarding NFLPA report cards
content: The NFL won its grievance against the NFL Players Association, effectively banning the union from conducting and publishing future player report cards.

title: Pats' Diggs pleads not guilty to assault allegation
content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs pleaded not guilty to felony strangulation and other criminal charges stemming from an alleged dispute with his personal chef.

title: ISU defends ice dance scoring amid controversy
content: The ISU is standing by the judging of ice dance at the Winter Olympics, where the scores from the French judge played a role in the French team of Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron beating the American team of Madison Chock and Evan Bates.

title: Big Ten details 24-team CFP plan, no title games
content: The Big Ten is circulating an internal document that lays out what a 24-team CFP would look like, including the elimination of conference championship games, a 23+1 selection model and an additional weekend of on-campus CFP home games.

title: Ukrainian racer loses DQ appeal over helmet
content: Ukrainian skeleton athlete Vladyslav Heraskevych's appeal of his disqualification from the Milan Cortina Olympics has been denied by the Court of Arbitration for Sport.

title: Sources: Spurs finalizing Tudor as interim boss
content: Tottenham are finalising the appointment of Igor Tudor as interim head coach until the end of the season, sources have told ESPN.

title: Longtime fugitive nabbed trying to attend Games
content: A Slovak fugitive who had been on the run for 16 years was finally arrested when he turned up in Milan to support his national ice hockey team at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, police said.

title: Trump pardons include Klecko, Newton, Lewis
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon.

content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

content: The Last Four In and First Four Out groupings feature teams with big wins -- and high potential for March.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts, earned the pole Wednesday with a lap at 183.925 mph.

content: For the first time this season, there's a shake-up on the top line. Vanderbilt beat Texas to unseat the Longhorns.

content: Who's the Premier League's fastest player? The slowest? Best passer? The worst? And more. Here are 25 superlatives from different skills.

content: Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester United are all monitoring Club Brugge midfielder Aleksandar Stankovic. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: "Let's See If We'll Live": 4 Bihar Girls Die After Consuming Poison As Experiment
content: Recounting the moments leading up to the tragedy, the survivor told NDTV: "My friend said, 'let's eat it and see if we will live or die. They gulped the poison meant to kill herons with water. I had very little of it and spat it out immediately, so I

title: Gujarat Appoints Veteran Banker Uday Kotak As Chairman Of GIFT City
content: Gujarat has appointed veteran banker Uday Kotak as the chairman of GIFT City, replacing former bureaucrat Hasmukh Adhia, according to a notice by the state government.

title: 2 Men Jailed In UK Over Islamic State-Inspired Plot To Kill Hundreds Of Jews
content: Two men were jailed on Friday for plotting to kill hundreds in an Islamic State-inspired attack on the Jewish community in England, a plan prosecutors said could have been deadlier than December's mass shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach.

title: No More Paying Full Toll For Incomplete Expressways Under New Rules
content: The Centre has announced a change in toll collection rules for National Expressways. Now, the commuters won't pay the full toll if an expressway is not fully operational.

title: "Then Get Out Of Here": Minister Anil Vij, Senior Cop Argue Over Suspension
content: A grievance redressal meeting saw a heated exchange between Haryana Minister Anil Vij and a senior police officer over the suspension of a sub-inspector accused of fraud.

title: PM Modi To Inaugurate Rs 3,000-Crore Bridge Over Brahmaputra In Assam
content: Guwahati is about to get a whole lot smaller, in the best way possible. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the six-lane Kumar Bhaskar Varma Setu over the Brahmaputra on February 14.

title: How India Plans To Rebuild Bangladesh Ties After BNP's Landslide Victory
content: India is weighing its next steps with cautious optimism after a decisive electoral verdict in Bangladesh that has handed a landslide victory to the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), ending a turbulent interim phase.

title: Punjab AAP Holds Protest Against Congress' Partap Singh Bajwa Over 'Casteist' Remarks
content: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Punjab, on Friday, held statewide protests against the Leader of Opposition Partap Singh Bajwa over his casteist and derogatory remarks targeting Minister Harbhajan Singh ETO.

title: BJP Leader Arrested, Illegal Properties Razed For Allegedly Abusing Madhya Pradesh Judge On Road
content: A dramatic showdown between the judiciary and a ruling party functionary erupted in Dewas, after BJP leader Pankaj Gharu was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with a judge triggering not just a criminal case, but a swift demolition drive.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Scripted Posts, Late-Night Calls: How A 'Rescue Op' Saved UK PM Starmer's Job
content: For now, Keir Starmer has bought time, but heads sans party loyalty. His authority rests on temporary endorsements and managed optics.

title: Exclusive: In Macron's Return To India, Defence, AI And People At Core Of Familiar Partnership
content: French President Emmanuel Macron begins his three-day visit to India on February 17 with a schedule that mixes remembrance, business, technology and geopolitics, an itinerary designed to underline how far the India-France relationship travelled.

title: Bill Gates, Tony Blair, And Sundar Pichai Among Key Attendees At India AI Summit
content: India's first-ever Artificial Intelligence Impact Summit is scheduled in New Delhi's Bharat Mandapam from February 16 to 20, bringing together global leaders, innovators and policymakers.

title: Imran Khan To Be Shifted To New Jail With Medical Facilities: Pak Minister
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi told the media on Friday that the former prime minister of the country, Imran Khan, will be transferred to the new Islamabad jail once the facility is fully constructed within the next two months.

title: UP Man Beaten To Death By Cop, Others For Objecting To People Urinating Near House
content: A 45-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death after he objected to some wedding guests urinating near his house in the Naini area of Prayagraj district, police said on Friday, adding that six of the 12 named accused have been arrested.

title: Air India Flew Plane 8 Times Without Airworthiness Permit, Fined Rs 1 Crore
content: In its order imposing the fine, the DGCA observed that the Airbus A320 aircraft was flown on multiple sectors, including flights connecting New Delhi, Bengaluru, Mumbai and Hyderabad.

title: 'Godman', Poison Laddoo, 'Djinn' Ritual: How Delhi Triple Murder Was Executed
content: From poison-laced laddoos to claims involving Djinns (supernatural beings), each new revelation has added another disturbing layer to the triple murder case in Delhi's Peeragarhi.

title: RERA In Trouble? Why Supreme Court Warned It Can Be Shut Down
content: The Supreme Court issued a scathing remark on the Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) on Thursday. Chief Justice Surya Kant said RERA has accomplished nothing concrete beyond providing benefits to defaulting builders.

title: On Camera, Speeding Sports Bike Hits Doctor In Uttarakhand, Rider Flees

title: Trump goes cold on global warming: US puts key climate safeguards on ice
content: president revoked the 2009 "endangerment finding" issued under Barack Obama . the ruling empowered the EPA to regulate carbon dioxide, methane and other climate pollutants under the Clean Air Act . without it, the legal backbone of American climate policy collapses .

title: As New Delhi turns 95, PMO shifts to Seva Teerth: City's layered past shapes its legacy
content: new Delhi turned 95 today, a milestone that binds two moments of power separated by nearly a century . in 1931, the British formally inaugurated New Delhi as the imperial capital . ninety-five years later, prime minister Narendra Modi marked a symbolic departure from that legacy by shifting the Prime Minister’s Office from South Block to 'Seva Teerth'
